tweet_text:
@HKilset @chucker @film_girl Yes, because the previous 30-pin iPod connector was 10 years old at that point and **sucked**. They changed to Lightning because it offered clear advantages over their own connector and micro-USB.

Market innovations sparked the change. Imagine if 30-pin became the EU standard.

tweet_text:
@spectresofmarx @Tintenfrisch13 @Blaynos14 Current spec says 100W is the power limit.  They will probably go to 150W, but physical limitations of the connector become more and more important the more lower you try to squeeze through those tiny junction points.

Everything can get better.
